author: Adrian Kajumba
title: Crystal Palace pull the plug on warm-weather training trip to Dubai after Sunderland
text:
It's all gone Pete Tong at Selhurst Park this season (Photo: Action Images via Reuters)     
Crystal Palace have pulled the plug on a planned trip to Dubai next week. 
Sam Allardyce was due to take advantage of Palace’s upcoming fortnight break by taking his squad to the Middle East as he did with Sunderland last year. 
But the mid-season training camp been cancelled with Palace chiefs concerned about how the trip would be viewed by their supporters. 
Tensions are already running high after their 4-0 thumping at home to relegation rivals Sunderland. Damien Delaney confronted by a fan (Photo: Rex Features) 
Supporters turned on boss Allardyce and his team and one fan was arrested after he attempted to confront defender Damien Delaney. 
Palace players have already been given a post-match dressing down by chairman Steve Parish before being called in for a 7am Sunday morning inquest following the Sunderland shocker. 
And they will now be put through their paces in England next week rather than abroad. 
It is has become common for Premier League clubs not in FA Cup fifth-round action to jet off at this time of year. It's a painful time for Big Sam right now (Photo: PA Wire) 
Allardyce’s former club West Ham, Everton and Stoke are among the clubs also expected to be in Dubai next week. 
The trips are designed as warm weather training and team-bonding escapes. 
But players are also given significant downtime while they are away and some have landed themselves in hot water. 
QPR’S Dubai camp four years ago was likened to a “stag party” by some first teamers.
